item.title: Ockham's Razor with Dr. Kevin Kelly
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description: Dr. Kevin Kelly from Carnegie Mellon University will be our guest to discuss Ockham's Razor. Dr. Kelly has done a lot of research on the justification of Ockham's Razor and why it leads to true theories better than alternative methods. You can check out his work at http://www.andrew.cmu.edu/user/kk3n/ockham/Ockham.htm
item.itunes:author: infidelguy
item.itunes:subtitle: Ockham's Razor with Dr. Kevin Kelly

item.title: The Arrow of Time with Dr. Sean M. Carroll
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description:
Dr. Sean M. Carroll will be joining us to discuss his book From Eternity to Here: The Quest for the Ultimate Theory of Time. Dr. Carroll is a theoretical physicist at Caltech and contributes to Cosmic Variance, one of the most popular science blogs on the Web. You can check out Dr. Carroll's work at http://preposterousuniverse.com.
Listen Live at http://www.infidelguy.com/chatroom.html
item.itunes:author: infidelguy
item.itunes:subtitle: The Arrow of Time with Dr. Sean M. Carroll

item.title: The New Atheists as Divine Prophets with Rev. Michael Dowd
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description:
Michael Dowd, author of Thank God For Evolution, makes his second appearance on the show to talk about his upcoming article for Skeptic Magazine entitled "The New Atheists as Divine Prophets". Dowd is a former minister in the United Church of Christ who currently runs a ministry with the purpose of teaching theists about the theory of evolution.
Check out his Web site at http://thankgodforevolution.com/.
Listen live at: http://www.infidelguy.com/live.m3u
item.itunes:author: infidelguy
item.itunes:subtitle: The New Atheists as Divine Prophets with Rev. Michael Dowd

item.title: Was Darwin Wrong? with Jerry Fodor and Massimo Pigliucci
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description: Dr. Jerry Fodor, a cognitive scientist and philosopher, will be our guest tonight to discuss his book, What Darwin Got Wrong. While Fodor is a naturalist who accepts the idea of common descent, he doesn't accept natural selection as the mechanism for evolution. Also joining us as co-host will be Dr. Massimo Pigliucci.
item.itunes:author: infidelguy
item.itunes:subtitle: Was Darwin Wrong? with Jerry Fodor and Massimo Pigliucci
item.itunes:summary: Dr. Jerry Fodor, a cognitive scientist and philosopher, will be our guest tonight to discuss his book, What Darwin Got Wrong. While Fodor is a naturalist who accepts the idea of common descent, he doesn't accept natural selection as the mechanism for evolution. Also joining us as co-host will be Dr. Massimo Pigliucci.
item.itunes:keywords: science, religion, philosophy, atheism, debate, agnostic, theology, interviews, liberal, conversation, christian, news

item.title: Rethinking Race with Guy Harrison
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description: Guy P. Harrison returns to the show to discuss his book Race and Reality: What Everyone Should Know About Our Biological Diversity. Topics to be discussed will be the concept of biological race, intelligence, and IQ. You can check out Guy's Web site at http://guyharrison.info.
item.itunes:author: infidelguy
item.itunes:subtitle: Rethinking Race with Guy Harrison

item.itunes:keywords: science, religion, philosophy, atheism, debate, agnostic, theology, interviews, liberal, conversation, christian, news

item.title: Evolution, Science, and Pseudoscience with Dr. Massimo Pigliucci
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description:
Dr. Massimo Pigliucci will return to the show tonight to discuss his two new books that were released this month: Nonsense on Stilts and Evolution: The Extended Synthesis. Nonsense on Stilts concerns the boundaries between science and pseudoscience along with areas of inquiry that are almost science. Evolution: The Extended Synthesis is a collection of essays contributed by the attendees of the Altenberg Conference that outline how evolutionary biology has changed since the publication of Julian Huxley's The Modern Systhesis.
You can purchase both books at http://tinyurl.com/2g5vbjc and http://tinyurl.com/2ctdo3d
Also, check out Massimo's blog at: http://rationallyspeaking.blogspot.com
item.itunes:author: infidelguy
item.itunes:subtitle: Evolution, Science, and Pseudoscience with Dr. Massimo Pigliucci
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: Consumer Gullibility and The Media
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description: Tonight we will be joined by Valerie, IG's wife and frequent co-host, to discuss consumer gullibility and the tricks that marketers and advertisers use to entice their viewers into buying. We will discuss tv commercials, product placements, reality TV shows, the news and more.

item.title: Psychomythology with Dr. Scott Lilienfeld
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description:
Can subliminal messages really persuade you? How accurate are polygraph tests. We will discuss these issues and more with Dr. Scott Lilienfeld, a Professor of Psychology at Emory University and the author of 50 Great Myths of Popular Psychology.
You can purchase Dr. Lilienfeld's book at http://tinyurl.com/ydr5g8l

item.title: Episode 519 - Martial Arts Mysticism with Ken Gullette
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description:
Joining us this week will be Ken Gullette to discuss mysticism found in the martial arts such as the concept of chi as well as other areas of the martial arts the we should be skeptical of.
Ken Gullette is a 36-year veteran of the martial arts who has studied with members of the family that created tai chi (the Chen fam...ily). He is a tournament champion and is the owner and instructor of Internal Fighting Arts.com, an online school. He also produces instructional DVDs.
item.itunes:author: infidelguy
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 519 - Martial Arts Mysticism with Ken Gullette

item.title: Episode 518 - Meeting with the Obama Administration with Melody Hensley
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description:
Melody Hensley will join us this week to discuss the meeting between the secular community and the Obama Adminstration that occurred last week.
Melody Hensley is the Executive Director of CFI Washington, DC. Ms. Hensley has a background in volunteering and community organizing. She has been involved with church-state separation and secular activism, as well as reproductive rights and progressive issues, in the DC area for over a decade. Prior to her latest role, she served as the CFI DC Event and Volunteer Coordinator.
item.itunes:author: infidelguy

item.title: Episode 517 - A Muslim Journey with Lisa Bauer
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description: Lisa Bauer will be our guest to discuss her seven years as an American Muslim. Over the past three months, Lisa's story has been featured in Free Inquiry. You can check out part one here: http://www.secularhumanism.org/index.php?section=library&page=bauer_29_6

item.title: Episode 515 - A Defense of Religion with Bruce Sheiman
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description: Although he's an atheist, Bruce Sheiman is a staunch defender of the good the religion has done in the world. He will be our guest to discuss the earthquake in Haiti and how religious charities will help the survivor there. Mr. Sheiman is the author of "An Atheist Defends Religion" which is available at: http://www.amazon.com/Atheist-Defends-Religion-Humanity-Without/dp/1592578543
item.itunes:author: infidelguy

item.title: Episode 511 - The Church-State Wars with Jay Wexler
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description:
Jay Wexler, a professor of law at Boston University, will be our guest to discuss the famous church-state Supreme Court cases. Wexler is the author of "Holy Hullabaloos: A Road Trip to the Battlegrounds of the Church-State Wars".
Check out his website at http://www.holyhullabaloos.com and purchase his book at http://www.amazon.com/Holy-Hullabaloos-Battlegrounds-Church-State/dp/0807000442

item.title: Repeat - The Origins of Christmas and Easter
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description: Barbara Walker is an author of 22 books on various subjects dealing with religious history, mythology and etymology. Walker has appeared on TLC, the Discovery Channel, and many other television programs. Her written material is used in programs around the nation.

item.title: Episode 510 - Contemporary Ethics with Alonzo Fyfe
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description:
Alonzo Fyfe returns to the show to discuss various issues involving contemporary ethics including The Manhatten Declaration, a document outlining Christian ethics, and climate change. Fyfe is the author of the book, A Better Place: Selected Essays in Desire Utilitarianism.
You can purchase his book at http://www.lulu.com/content/505269.

item.title: Episode 508 - Fundamentalist Atheism with Frank Schaeffer
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description:
Frank Schaeffer will be returning to the show to discuss fundamentalist atheism, his work with the Military Religious Freedom Foundation, and his latest book Patience With God: Faith for People Who Don't Like Religion { or Atheism }. Frank is the son of Francis Schaeffer, a Christian apologist who helped to found the Religious Right.
Check out Frank's work at: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/frank-schaeffer

item.title: Episode 506 - Viral Religion with Dr. Darrel Ray
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description:
Dr. Darrel Ray will be our guest to discuss memes and how religion is analogous to a virus. Dr. Ray is the author of the book The God Virus: How Religion Infects Our Lives and Culture.
Check out his Web site at http://www.thegodvirus.net or purchase his book at http://www.amazon.com/God-Virus-religion-infects-culture/dp/0970950519/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1257973317&sr=8-1

item.title: Episode 504 - Blogging the Bible with David Plotz
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description: David Plotz, editor of Slate.com, will join us to discuss his commentary on the Bible. After reading the Bible for the first time without the aid of scholarship, Plotz kept a running commentary of his thoughts on each book in the Old Testament, which has since been published as "Good Book: The Bizarre, Hilarious, Disturbing, Marvelous, and Inspiring Things I Learned When I Read Every Single Word of the Bible".

item.title: Episode 500 - Fighting Against "The Gay Agenda"
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description: Anti-Gay Rapper and Atheist, Charlie Check'm reappears but in a different capacity this time. Check'm says he doesn't hate gays but believes that "homos" have brain damage and that they shouldn't be allowed to marry. He makes an appearance to defend his stance and also explains why he thinks any rational person, especially atheists and agnostics, should also be against the "gay agenda".

item.title: Episode 498 - Eternal Earth-bound Pets with Dromedary Hump
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description:

item.title: Episode 487 - Atheism Advanced with Dr. Jack David Eller
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description:
Dr. Jack David Eller will be our guest to discuss his rather unique book, "Atheism Advanced". Dr. Eller is a cultural anthropologist and the author of works such as "Natural Atheism", "From Culture to Ethnicity to Violence", and "Violence and Culture".
You can visit his web site at http://www.geocities.com/naturalatheism and purchase his book at http://www.amazon.com/Atheism-Advanced-Further-Thoughts-Freethinker/dp/1578840023

item.title: EPISODE 485 - Atheism and Naturalism with Ryan Covington
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description:
Ryan Covingtion will be our guest to discuss his new book, "Atheism and Naturalism". Ryan is a former fundamentalist Christian who got involved in the creationism/evolution debate a few years ago. He currently blogs at http://aigbusted.blogspot.com where he critique many of the claims put forth by apologists and creationists.
His book can be purchased at: http://www.lulu.com/content/paperback-book/atheism-and-naturalism/6307598

item.title: Why Creationism Fails - Frank Zindler
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description: Frank Zindler is a former professor of biology and geology in the State University of New York. He is currently the Editor of American Atheist Magazine and Director of American Atheists Press. He appears tonight to discuss Young Earth Creationism, typical arguments from YEC's against Evolution, Geology Facts that don't support YEC, discuss Noah's Flood and well, basically... he's going to destroy Biblical Creationism.
item.itunes:author: infidelguy

item.title: The Doctrine of No Self - Charles Goodman
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description: Professor Charles Goodman of Binghamton University appears on the program to give us an introduction to Buddhist philosophy Charles Goodman, professor of eastern philosophy at Binghamton University, reappears on the program to discuss why atheists should believe the doctrine that there is no such thing as an individual self. Goodman's last program was a hit, when he discussed Buddhism and the Buddhist's rejection of the existence of God.

item.title: Remembering Hypatia of Alexandria
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description: Brian Trent is the author of the award-winning novel REMEMBERING HYPATIA, which has just recently been nominated for Book of the Year by ForeWord Magazine. This true story of a brilliant woman erased from history has garnered high praise from Writer's Digest, National Public Radio, and Yale, among many others.

item.title: Has Man Evolved From Other Species? - Dr. Pigliucci vs Robert Allen
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description: Dr. Massimo Pigliucci, well known evolutionary biologist, and Robert Allen debate: "Has Man Evolved from Other Species?' Massimo kindly agrees to appear on the program to defend the theory that man evolved. Dr. Massimo Pigliucci is an associate professor of ecology and evolution at SUNY Stony Brook. Robert Allen is a former evolutionist that has been debating origins for over 25 years. He is currently a research associate in the Fish Diagnostics Laboratory at the University of Mississippi and earned his B.S. in Education (Zoology and Botany) in 1970. He later earned his M.S. in Education (Combined Sciences) in 1989 from William Carey College a Christian College. One of the students on the front page of the college's website is quoted as saying, "I chose Carey because I wanted a Christian education..."
item.itunes:author: infidelguy
item.itunes:subtitle: Has Man Evolved From Other Species? - Dr. Pigliucci vs Robert Allen

item.title: Can God Be Disproven? - Austin Dacey
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description: Austin has lectured and published widely on issues at the intersection of science, religion, ethics, and society. He works for the Center for Inquiry, a think tank affiliated with the State University of New York at Buffalo. He serves as director of research and education; executive editor of Philo, an academic journal specializing in philosophical naturalism; a contributor to the magazines Skeptical Inquirer and Free Inquiry, and chair of the New York office. In 2002 he earned a doctorate in philosophy. He lives in New York City.
item.itunes:author: infidelguy
item.itunes:subtitle: Can God Be Disproven? - Austin Dacey

He works for the Center for Inquiry, a think tank affiliated with the State University of New York at Buffalo. item.title: Capitalism vs Socialism - Revisited
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description: Todd Reinhardt reappears after being challenged by Anton Batey. Anton heard the previous show about Socialism and Capitalism and figured he could provide information crucial to understanding how Socialism works, debunking myths about Socialism and destroying justifications for Capitalism. I think this program is far superior to the first as far as the Socialism side goes. Great show all around.

item.title: Atheist and Blind - A Foxhole Atheist
item.author: infidelguy@infidelguy.com
item.description:
Andy appears on the program representing once again, another atheist in a foxhole, so to speak. Andy will speak to us about becoming an atheist while blind.
Andy also wishes to share with us how even though blindness is considered a vulnerability that ".. you can live a very fullfilling and wonderful life."
I apologize in advance for the sound quality. I mistakenly encoded it at a lower bitrate than I intended. EXTRAS:
* Andy calls back to let us hear his speech to text program and we also rant about a few other things. 10 minutes: LISTEN IN
